<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	For the year ended December 31, 2014, the diluted loss
	per share calculation for continued and discontinued operations did not include a weighted average number of 14,612 shares of
	unvested restricted common stock and a weighted average number of exercisable in-the-money options to purchase up to 441,559 shares
	of the Company&#8217;s common stock, respectively, because their effect was anti-dilutive, as the Company incurred a loss for
	the year for both continued and discontinued operations.
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	29.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Share-based compensation expenses
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	The Company granted 50,000 shares and 40,000 shares
	of the Company&#8217;s restricted common stock to its investor relations services provider, in exchange for its services to the
	Company for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. These shares were valued at US$1.20 per share and US$0.84
	per share, the closing bid price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of grant, respectively. Total compensation expense
	recognized for the services was US$60,000 and US$33,600 for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	The Company granted 300,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s
	restricted common stock to a technical service provider in exchange for its services to the Company for a 12-month period commencing
	on August 1, 2014. These shares were valued at US$0.67 per share, the closing bid price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on
	the date of grant. Total compensation expense amortized for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 was approximately US$117,000
	and US$84,000, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	The Company granted 350,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s
	restricted common stock to a management consulting service provider in exchange for its services to the Company for a 24-month
	period commencing on May 1, 2015. These shares were valued at US$1.57 per share, the closing bid price of the Company&#8217;s
	common stock on the date of grant. Total compensation expense recognized for the year ended December 31, 2015 was approximately
	US$183,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	The Company granted 60,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s
	restricted common stock to another management consulting service provider in exchange for its services to the Company. These shares
	were valued at US$0.90 per share, the closing bid price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of grant. Total compensation
	expense recognized for the year ended December 31, 2015 was approximately US$54,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	On September 14, 2015, under its 2015 Omnibus Securities
	and Incentive Plan, the Company granted its employees and directors in the aggregate of 665,592 shares of the Company&#8217;s
	restricted common stock, which will be vested on the third anniversary of the date of the grant. These shares were valued at $0.84
	per share, the closing bid price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of grant. The Company adopted a 5% forfeiture
	rate for recognition of the related compensation expenses of these unvested shares, total compensation cost recognized for the
	year ended December 31, 2015 was approximately US$53,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.25IN">
	On December 30, 2014, the Company issued 4,200,000 shares
	of the Company&rsquo;s restricted common stock to its executive officers, of which 1,533,333 restricted shares were vested upon
	issuance, 1,333,333 restricted shares were vested on December 30, 2015 and the remaining 1,333,334 restricted shares will be vested
	on December 30, 2016. The restricted stock was valued at $1.17 per share, the closing bid price of the Company&rsquo;s common stock
	on the date of grant. Total compensation cost recognized for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 was US$1,560,000 and US$1,794,000,
	respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.25IN">
	On December 30, 2014, the Company issued its management,
	employees and directors in the aggregate of 2,418,780 shares of the Company&rsquo;s restricted common stock for the services they
	provided to the Company. The restricted stock is subject to a strict lock-up for an initial six-month period. Following the initial
	six-month period, the restricted stock will continue to be locked up until the earlier of (i) the date upon which the closing price
	of the Company's common stock equals or exceeds $2.50 for five consecutive trading days, and (ii) December 30, 2016. In addition,
	the restricted stock is subject to forfeiture upon an employee's cessation of employment at the discretion of the Company. The
	restricted stock was fully vested upon issuance and was valued at $1.17 per share, the closing bid price of the Company&rsquo;s
	common stock on the date of grant. Total compensation cost recognized for the year ended December 31, 2014 was US$2,830,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	On September 14, 2015, under its 2015 Omnibus Securities
	and Incentive Plan, the Company also granted 5-year common stock purchase options to its employees and directors, in the aggregate,
	to purchase up to 1,193,100 shares of the Company&#8217;s restricted common stock at an exercise price of US$0.84 per share, of
	which 397,700 options was vested upon the date of grant, 397,700 options will be vested on September 14, 2016 and the remaining
	397,700 options will be vested on September 14, 2017. The Company adopted a 5% forfeiture rate for recognition of the related compensation
	expenses of the unvested part of options, total compensation expenses recognized for these options for the year ended December
	31, 2015 was approximately US$229,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	On December 30, 2014, the Company granted 5-year options
	to each of its three independent directors, Mr. Douglas MacLellan, Mr. Mototaka Watanabe and Mr. Zhiqing Chen, to purchase in
	the aggregate 200,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at an exercise price of US$1.23 per share, in consideration of
	their services to the Company. These options were fully vested and exercisable upon issuance and subject to forfeiture upon the
	termination of the Optionee&#8217;s status as a director for any reason. Total compensation expenses recognized for these options
	for the year ended December 31, 2014 was US$99,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	The Company estimated the fair value of these options
	granted on December 30, 2014 using the Binomial option-pricing model based on the following assumptions:
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.25IN">
	Applicable stock price is based on the closing bid price
	of the Company&rsquo;s common stock on the respective grant date, after adjustment for the restricted shares granted/cancelled
	on the respective grant date. Exercise multiple is used as the estimated ratio of fair value of stock over the exercise price as
	at the time the option is exercised. Tenor is the contract life of the option. Yield-to-maturities in continuous compounding of
	the United States Government Bonds with the time-to-maturities same as the expected tenor of the options are adopted as the risk-free
	rate. Annualized historical stock price volatility of the Company from an appropriate index as at the respective grant date is
	deemed to be appropriate to serve as the expected volatility of the stock price of the Company and is assumed to be constant and
	prevailing. The dividend yield is calculated based on management&rsquo;s estimate of dividends to be paid on the underlying stock.
	Exercise price of the option is the contractual exercise price of the option.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	On December 30, 2014, the Company cancelled 155,190
	shares of the Company&#8217;s restricted common stock and options to purchase up to 190,500 of the Company&#8217;s common stock,
	respectively, which were issued under the Company&#8217;s 2011 Omnibus Securities and Incentive Plan due to cessation of employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">

	and their movements for the two years then ended are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	The aggregate unrecognized share-based compensation
	expenses as of December 31, 2015 and 2014 is approximately US$2,741,000 and US$3,237,000, respectively.
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">

	&nbsp;

<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	30.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Subsequent event
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	In January 2016, the Company issued 50,000 shares of
	the Company&rsquo;s restricted common stock to its investor relations services provider in exchange for its services for the year
	ended December 31, 2016. These shares were granted in January 2015 and valued at US$1.2 per share, the closing bid price of the
	Company&rsquo;s common stock on the date of grant. Total compensation expense of approximately US$60,000 will be recognized for
	the year ended December 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	In March 2016, the Company issued 665,592 shares of the
	Company&rsquo;s unvested restricted common stock, which was granted in September 2015 under its 2015 Omnibus Securities and Incentive
	Plan as discussed in Note 29.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	During the first fiscal quarter of 2016, the Company paid
	approximately RMB9.1 million (approximately US$1.4 million) in relation to a software development contract entered into in November
	2015 as discussed in Note 12.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">

<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_21"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Exhibit 21.1
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
	Subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	China Net Online Media Group Limited, a British Virgin Islands company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	China Net Online Media Group Limited is the sole shareholder
	of CNET Online Technology Limited, a Hong Kong company, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	the sole shareholder of ChinaNet
	Investment Holding Ltd., a British Virgin Islands company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	ChinaNet Investment Holding Ltd. is a 40% shareholder of ChinaNet Holdings Korea, a Korean
	company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	CNET Online Technology Limited is the sole shareholder of Rise King Century Technology
	Development (Beijing) Co., Ltd., a wholly foreign-owned enterprise (&ldquo;WFOE&rdquo;), established in the People&rsquo;s Republic
	of China (the &ldquo;PRC&rdquo;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The WFOE is the sole shareholder of ChinaNet Online Holdings Co., Ltd., a PRC company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	ChinaNet Online Holdings Co., Ltd., is a 19% shareholder of ChinaNet Chuangtou (Shenzhen)
	Co., Ltd., a PRC company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Through a series of contractual agreements between the WFOE and Business Opportunity
	Online (as defined below) and Beijing CNET Online (as defined below), the Company, through the WFOE, secures significant rights
	to influence the three companies&rsquo; business operations, policies and management, approve all matters requiring shareholder
	approval, and the right to receive 100% of the income earned by the two companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Business Opportunity Online (Beijing) Network Technology Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Business Opportunity Online&rdquo;), incorporated
	in the PRC.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Beijing CNET Online Advertising Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Beijing CNET Online&rdquo;), incorporated in the PRC.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Beijing CNET Online is a 51% shareholder of Shanghai Borongdingsi Computer Technology
	Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Shanghai Borongdingsi&rdquo;), a 19% shareholder of Guohua Shiji (Beijing) Communication Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Guohua
	Shiji&rdquo;), a 10% shareholder of Beijing Saturday Education Technology Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Beijing Saturday&rdquo;) and a 10%
	shareholder of Chuangshi Meiwei Food and Beverage Investment Management (Beijing) Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Chuangshi Meiwei&rdquo;), each
	of which is incorporated in the PRC.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Business Opportunity Online is a 51% shareholder of Beijing Chuang Fu Tian Xia Network
	Technology Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Beijing Chuang Fu Tian Xia&rdquo;), the sole shareholder of Business Opportunity Online (Hubei) Network
	Technology Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Business Opportunity Online Hubei&rdquo;), the sole shareholder of Quanzhou City Zhilang Network Technology
	Co., Ltd (&ldquo;Quanzhou Zhi Lang&rdquo;), the sole shareholder of Beijing Chuang Shi Xin Qi Advertising Media Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Beijing
	Chuang Shi Xin Qi&rdquo;), the sole shareholder of Beijing Hong Da Shi Xing Network Technology Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Beijing Hong Da
	Shi Xing&rdquo;), the sole shareholder of Beijing Shi Ji Cheng Yuan Advertising Media Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Beijing Shi Ji Cheng Yuan&rdquo;)
	and a 23.18% shareholder of Shenzhen City Mingshan Network Technology Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Shenzhen Mingshan&rdquo;), each of which
	is incorporated in the PRC.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Business Opportunity Online Hubei is the sole shareholder of Hubei CNET Advertising Media
	Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Hubei CNET&rdquo;), the sole shareholder of Sheng Tian Network Technology (Hubei) Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Sheng Tian
	Hubei&rdquo;), and a 25.5% shareholder of Zhao Shang Ke Network Technology (Hubei) Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Zhao Shang Ke Hubei&rdquo;),
	each of which is incorporated in the PRC.
</P>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_31>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_31"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Exhibit 31.1
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	CERTIFICATION
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	I, Handong Cheng, the Chief Executive Officer of the registrant, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#9;I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of ChinaNet
	Online Holdings, Inc., for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(2)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue
	statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances
	under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(3)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other
	financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations
	and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this&nbsp;report;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(4)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The registrant&rsquo;s other certifying officers and I are
	responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and
	15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15a-15(f)) for the registrant
	and have:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	a.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such
	disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant,
	including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during&nbsp;the period
	in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	b.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused
	such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding
	the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally
	accepted accounting principles:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	c.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&rsquo;s disclosure
	controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures,
	as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	d.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&rsquo;s
	internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&rsquo;s fourth fiscal quarter that has materially
	affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(5)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The registrant&rsquo;s other certifying officer and I have
	disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&rsquo;s auditors
	and the audit committee of the&nbsp;registrant&rsquo;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	a.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design
	or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&rsquo;s
	ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	b.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management
	or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Date: April 14, 2016
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	By:
<U>
	/s/ Handong Cheng
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Name: Handong Cheng
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Title:&nbsp;&nbsp;Chief Executive Officer
</P>

	&nbsp;

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_2"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	CERTIFICATION
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	I, Zhige Zhang, the Chief Financial Officer of the registrant, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(1)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of ChinaNet
	Online Holdings, Inc., for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(2)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue
	statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances
	under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(3)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other
	financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations
	and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(4)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The registrant&rsquo;s other certifying officers and I are
	responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and
	15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15a-15(f)) for the registrant
	and have:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	a.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such
	disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant,
	including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during&nbsp;the period
	in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	b.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused
	such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding
	the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally
	accepted accounting principles:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	c.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&rsquo;s disclosure
	controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures,
	as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	d.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&rsquo;s
	internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&rsquo;s fourth fiscal quarter that has materially
	affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(5)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The registrant&rsquo;s other certifying officer and I have
	disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&rsquo;s auditors
	and the audit committee of the&nbsp;registrant&rsquo;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	a.&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design
	or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&rsquo;s
	ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	b.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#9;any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management
	or&nbsp;other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&rsquo;s&nbsp;&nbsp;internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 1IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	By:
<U>
	/s/ Zhige Zhang
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Name: Zhige Zhang

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_3"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Certification&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350,
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	As Adopted
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Pursuant to Section 906 of the
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Sarbanes - Oxley Act of 2002
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	In connection with the Annual Report of ChinaNet Online Holdings,
	Inc. (the &ldquo;Company&rdquo;), on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2015 as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission
	(&ldquo;SEC&rdquo;) on the date hereof (the &ldquo;Report&rdquo;), each of the undersigned of the Company, certifies, pursuant
	to 18 U.S.C. &sect;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(1)&#9;the Report fully complies, in all material respects, with
	the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(2)&#9;the information contained in the Report fairly presents, in
	all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	By:
<U>
	/s/ Handong Cheng
</U>
</P>

	Name: Handong Cheng
